title: SpectraMind V50 — Neuro-symbolic, Physics-informed Exoplanet Spectroscopy Pipeline
description: SpectraMind V50 is a mission-grade, CLI-first, neuro-symbolic, physics-informed AI pipeline for the NeurIPS 2025 Ariel Data Challenge. It integrates a long-sequence Structured State-Space Model (SSM) for FGS1 time-series with a molecule- and wavelength-aware Graph Neural Network (GNN) for AIRS spectra; training uses Gaussian log-likelihood with symbolic/physics constraints. NASA-grade reproducibility is enforced via Hydra configs, DVC/lakeFS data versioning, CI workflows, Docker/Poetry environments, and deterministic self-tests. Outputs include per-wavelength μ and σ, plus diagnostics (UMAP/t‑SNE, SHAP, symbolic overlays, FFT, calibration maps) and leaderboard-ready Kaggle submissions. All functionality is orchestrated through a unified Typer CLI with integrated logging, symbolic validation, and diagnostics dashboards.
notes: This deposition is the archived release for reproducibility. For active development, issues, and CI artifacts, see the GitHub repository.
references: NeurIPS 2025 Ariel Data Challenge: Challenge overview and datasets.
Hydra, DVC/lakeFS, Docker/Poetry: Reproducible ML stack used in this software.
Diagnostics: UMAP/t-SNE, SHAP, symbolic overlays, FFT & calibration maps.
